member.name: M:StaticRecompilation.PEImage.Backup
member.summary: Creates a backup of the PE file

member.name: M:StaticRecompilation.PEImage.GetNextSection
member.summary: Call this member to retrieve an initialised new sectionheader for the PE-file

member.name: M:StaticRecompilation.ProcessMemoryStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:StaticRecompilation.ProcessMemoryStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.name: P:StaticRecompilation.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:StaticRecompilation.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:StaticRecompilation.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

members.member: Parse instruction flags, get opcode index
